types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: BuildArg
types.description: Key value object that represents a build argument.

types.name: CacheSharingMode
types.description: Sharing mode of the cache volume.

enumValues.name: SHARED
enumValues.description: Shares the cache volume amongst many build pipelines

enumValues.name: PRIVATE
enumValues.description: Keeps a cache volume for a single build pipeline

enumValues.name: LOCKED
enumValues.description: Shares the cache volume amongst many build pipelines, but will serialize the writes

types.name: CacheVolume
types.description: A directory whose contents persist across runs.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this CacheVolume.

types.name: CacheVolumeID
types.description: The `CacheVolumeID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type CacheVolume.

types.name: Client
types.description: The root of the DAG.

fields.name: blob
fields.description: Retrieves a content-addressed blob.

args.name: digest
args.description: Digest of the blob

args.name: size
args.description: Size of the blob

args.name: mediaType
args.description: Media type of the blob

args.name: uncompressed
args.description: Digest of the uncompressed blob

fields.name: builtinContainer
fields.description: Retrieves a container builtin to the engine.

args.name: digest
args.description: Digest of the image manifest

fields.name: cacheVolume
fields.description: Constructs a cache volume for a given cache key.

args.name: key
args.description: A string identifier to target this cache volume (e.g., "modules-cache").

fields.name: checkVersionCompatibility
fields.description: Checks if the current Dagger Engine is compatible with an SDK's required version.

args.name: version
args.description: Version required by the SDK.

fields.name: container
fields.description:
Creates a scratch container.

Optional platform argument initializes new containers to execute and publish as that platform. Platform defaults to that of the builder's host.

args.name: id
args.description: DEPRECATED: Use `loadContainerFromID` instead.

args.name: platform
args.description: Platform to initialize the container with.

fields.name: currentFunctionCall
fields.description:
The FunctionCall context that the SDK caller is currently executing in.

If the caller is not currently executing in a function, this will return an error.

fields.name: currentModule
fields.description: The module currently being served in the session, if any.

fields.name: currentTypeDefs
fields.description: The TypeDef representations of the objects currently being served in the session.

fields.name: defaultPlatform
fields.description: The default platform of the engine.

fields.name: directory
fields.description: Creates an empty directory.

args.name: id
args.description: DEPRECATED: Use `loadDirectoryFromID` instead.

fields.name: function
fields.description: Creates a function.

args.name: name
args.description: Name of the function, in its original format from the implementation language.

args.name: returnType
args.description: Return type of the function.

fields.name: generatedCode
fields.description: Create a code generation result, given a directory containing the generated code.

fields.name: git
fields.description: Queries a Git repository.

args.name: url
args.description:
URL of the git repository.

Can be formatted as `https://{host}/{owner}/{repo}`, `git@{host}:{owner}/{repo}`.

Suffix ".git" is optional.

args.name: keepGitDir
args.description: Set to true to keep .git directory.

args.name: experimentalServiceHost
args.description: A service which must be started before the repo is fetched.

args.name: sshKnownHosts
args.description: Set SSH known hosts

args.name: sshAuthSocket
args.description: Set SSH auth socket

fields.name: host
fields.description: Queries the host environment.

fields.name: http
fields.description: Returns a file containing an http remote url content.

args.name: url
args.description: HTTP url to get the content from (e.g., "https://docs.dagger.io").

args.name: experimentalServiceHost
args.description: A service which must be started before the URL is fetched.

fields.name: module
fields.description: Create a new module.

fields.name: moduleDependency
fields.description: Create a new module dependency configuration from a module source and name

args.name: source
args.description: The source of the dependency

args.name: name
args.description: If set, the name to use for the dependency. Otherwise, once installed to a parent module, the name of the dependency module will be used by default.

fields.name: moduleSource
fields.description: Create a new module source instance from a source ref string.

args.name: refString
args.description: The string ref representation of the module source

args.name: stable
args.description: If true, enforce that the source is a stable version for source kinds that support versioning.

fields.name: pipeline
fields.description: Creates a named sub-pipeline.

args.name: name
args.description: Name of the sub-pipeline.

args.name: description
args.description: Description of the sub-pipeline.

args.name: labels
args.description: Labels to apply to the sub-pipeline.

fields.name: secret
fields.description: Reference a secret by name.

fields.name: setSecret
fields.description:
Sets a secret given a user defined name to its plaintext and returns the secret.

The plaintext value is limited to a size of 128000 bytes.

args.name: name
args.description: The user defined name for this secret

args.name: plaintext
args.description: The plaintext of the secret

fields.name: socket
fields.description: Loads a socket by its ID.

fields.name: typeDef
fields.description: Create a new TypeDef.

types.name: Container
types.description: An OCI-compatible container, also known as a Docker container.

fields.name: asService
fields.description:
Turn the container into a Service.

Be sure to set any exposed ports before this conversion.

fields.name: asTarball
fields.description: Returns a File representing the container serialized to a tarball.

args.name: platformVariants
args.description:
Identifiers for other platform specific containers.

Used for multi-platform images.

args.name: forcedCompression
args.description:
Force each layer of the image to use the specified compression algorithm.

If this is unset, then if a layer already has a compressed blob in the engine's cache, that will be used (this can result in a mix of compression algorithms for different layers). If this is unset and a layer has no compressed blob in the engine's cache, then it will be compressed using Gzip.

args.name: mediaTypes
args.description:
Use the specified media types for the image's layers.

Defaults to OCI, which is largely compatible with most recent container runtimes, but Docker may be needed for older runtimes without OCI support.

fields.name: build
fields.description: Initializes this container from a Dockerfile build.

args.name: context
args.description: Directory context used by the Dockerfile.

args.name: dockerfile
args.description: Path to the Dockerfile to use.

args.name: target
args.description: Target build stage to build.

args.name: buildArgs
args.description: Additional build arguments.

args.name: secrets
args.description:
Secrets to pass to the build.

They will be mounted at /run/secrets/[secret-name] in the build container

They can be accessed in the Dockerfile using the "secret" mount type and mount path /run/secrets/[secret-name], e.g. RUN --mount=type=secret,id=my-secret curl [http://example.com?token=$(cat /run/secrets/my-secret)](http://example.com?token=$(cat /run/secrets/my-secret))

fields.name: defaultArgs
fields.description: Retrieves default arguments for future commands.

fields.name: directory
fields.description:
Retrieves a directory at the given path.

Mounts are included.

args.name: path
args.description: The path of the directory to retrieve (e.g., "./src").

fields.name: entrypoint
fields.description: Retrieves entrypoint to be prepended to the arguments of all commands.

fields.name: envVariable
fields.description: Retrieves the value of the specified environment variable.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the environment variable to retrieve (e.g., "PATH").

fields.name: envVariables
fields.description: Retrieves the list of environment variables passed to commands.

fields.name: experimentalWithAllGPUs
fields.description:
EXPERIMENTAL API! Subject to change/removal at any time.

Configures all available GPUs on the host to be accessible to this container.

This currently works for Nvidia devices only.

fields.name: experimentalWithGPU
fields.description:
EXPERIMENTAL API! Subject to change/removal at any time.

Configures the provided list of devices to be accessible to this container.

This currently works for Nvidia devices only.

args.name: devices
args.description: List of devices to be accessible to this container.

fields.name: export
fields.description:
Writes the container as an OCI tarball to the destination file path on the host.

Return true on success.

It can also export platform variants.

args.name: path
args.description:
Host's destination path (e.g., "./tarball").

Path can be relative to the engine's workdir or absolute.

args.name: platformVariants
args.description:
Identifiers for other platform specific containers.

Used for multi-platform image.

args.name: forcedCompression
args.description:
Force each layer of the exported image to use the specified compression algorithm.

If this is unset, then if a layer already has a compressed blob in the engine's cache, that will be used (this can result in a mix of compression algorithms for different layers). If this is unset and a layer has no compressed blob in the engine's cache, then it will be compressed using Gzip.

args.name: mediaTypes
args.description:
Use the specified media types for the exported image's layers.

Defaults to OCI, which is largely compatible with most recent container runtimes, but Docker may be needed for older runtimes without OCI support.

fields.name: exposedPorts
fields.description:
Retrieves the list of exposed ports.

This includes ports already exposed by the image, even if not explicitly added with dagger.

fields.name: file
fields.description:
Retrieves a file at the given path.

Mounts are included.

args.name: path
args.description: The path of the file to retrieve (e.g., "./README.md").

fields.name: from
fields.description: Initializes this container from a pulled base image.

args.name: address
args.description:
Image's address from its registry.

Formatted as [host]/[user]/[repo]:[tag] (e.g., "docker.io/dagger/dagger:main").

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Container.

fields.name: imageRef
fields.description: The unique image reference which can only be retrieved immediately after the 'Container.From' call.

fields.name: import
fields.description: Reads the container from an OCI tarball.

args.name: source
args.description: File to read the container from.

args.name: tag
args.description: Identifies the tag to import from the archive, if the archive bundles multiple tags.

fields.name: label
fields.description: Retrieves the value of the specified label.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the label (e.g., "org.opencontainers.artifact.created").

fields.name: labels
fields.description: Retrieves the list of labels passed to container.

fields.name: mounts
fields.description: Retrieves the list of paths where a directory is mounted.

fields.name: pipeline
fields.description: Creates a named sub-pipeline.

args.name: name
args.description: Name of the sub-pipeline.

args.name: description
args.description: Description of the sub-pipeline.

args.name: labels
args.description: Labels to apply to the sub-pipeline.

fields.name: platform
fields.description: The platform this container executes and publishes as.

fields.name: publish
fields.description:
Publishes this container as a new image to the specified address.

Publish returns a fully qualified ref.

It can also publish platform variants.

args.name: address
args.description:
Registry's address to publish the image to.

Formatted as [host]/[user]/[repo]:[tag] (e.g. "docker.io/dagger/dagger:main").

args.name: platformVariants
args.description:
Identifiers for other platform specific containers.

Used for multi-platform image.

args.name: forcedCompression
args.description:
Force each layer of the published image to use the specified compression algorithm.

If this is unset, then if a layer already has a compressed blob in the engine's cache, that will be used (this can result in a mix of compression algorithms for different layers). If this is unset and a layer has no compressed blob in the engine's cache, then it will be compressed using Gzip.

args.name: mediaTypes
args.description:
Use the specified media types for the published image's layers.

Defaults to OCI, which is largely compatible with most recent registries, but Docker may be needed for older registries without OCI support.

fields.name: rootfs
fields.description: Retrieves this container's root filesystem. Mounts are not included.

fields.name: stderr
fields.description:
The error stream of the last executed command.

Will execute default command if none is set, or error if there's no default.

fields.name: stdout
fields.description:
The output stream of the last executed command.

Will execute default command if none is set, or error if there's no default.

fields.name: sync
fields.description:
Forces evaluation of the pipeline in the engine.

It doesn't run the default command if no exec has been set.

fields.name: terminal
fields.description: Return an interactive terminal for this container using its configured default terminal command if not overridden by args (or sh as a fallback default).

args.name: cmd
args.description: If set, override the container's default terminal command and invoke these command arguments instead.

args.name: experimentalPrivilegedNesting
args.description:
Provides Dagger access to the executed command.

Do not use this option unless you trust the command being executed; the command being executed WILL BE GRANTED FULL ACCESS TO YOUR HOST FILESYSTEM.

args.name: insecureRootCapabilities
args.description: Execute the command with all root capabilities. This is similar to running a command with "sudo" or executing "docker run" with the "--privileged" flag. Containerization does not provide any security guarantees when using this option. It should only be used when absolutely necessary and only with trusted commands.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Retrieves the user to be set for all commands.

fields.name: withDefaultArgs
fields.description: Configures default arguments for future commands.

args.name: args
args.description: Arguments to prepend to future executions (e.g., ["-v", "--no-cache"]).

fields.name: withDefaultTerminalCmd
fields.description: Set the default command to invoke for the container's terminal API.

args.name: args
args.description: The args of the command.

args.name: experimentalPrivilegedNesting
args.description:
Provides Dagger access to the executed command.

Do not use this option unless you trust the command being executed; the command being executed WILL BE GRANTED FULL ACCESS TO YOUR HOST FILESYSTEM.

args.name: insecureRootCapabilities
args.description: Execute the command with all root capabilities. This is similar to running a command with "sudo" or executing "docker run" with the "--privileged" flag. Containerization does not provide any security guarantees when using this option. It should only be used when absolutely necessary and only with trusted commands.

fields.name: withDirectory
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a directory written at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the written directory (e.g., "/tmp/directory").

args.name: directory
args.description: Identifier of the directory to write

args.name: exclude
args.description: Patterns to exclude in the written directory (e.g. ["node_modules/**", ".gitignore", ".git/"]).

args.name: include
args.description: Patterns to include in the written directory (e.g. ["*.go", "go.mod", "go.sum"]).

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the directory and its contents.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

fields.name: withEntrypoint
fields.description: Retrieves this container but with a different command entrypoint.

args.name: args
args.description: Entrypoint to use for future executions (e.g., ["go", "run"]).

args.name: keepDefaultArgs
args.description: Don't remove the default arguments when setting the entrypoint.

fields.name: withEnvVariable
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus the given environment variable.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the environment variable (e.g., "HOST").

args.name: value
args.description: The value of the environment variable. (e.g., "localhost").

args.name: expand
args.description: Replace `${VAR}` or `$VAR` in the value according to the current environment variables defined in the container (e.g., "/opt/bin:$PATH").

fields.name: withExec
fields.description: Retrieves this container after executing the specified command inside it.

args.name: args
args.description:
Command to run instead of the container's default command (e.g., ["run", "main.go"]).

If empty, the container's default command is used.

args.name: skipEntrypoint
args.description: If the container has an entrypoint, ignore it for args rather than using it to wrap them.

args.name: stdin
args.description: Content to write to the command's standard input before closing (e.g., "Hello world").

args.name: redirectStdout
args.description: Redirect the command's standard output to a file in the container (e.g., "/tmp/stdout").

args.name: redirectStderr
args.description: Redirect the command's standard error to a file in the container (e.g., "/tmp/stderr").

args.name: experimentalPrivilegedNesting
args.description:
Provides Dagger access to the executed command.

Do not use this option unless you trust the command being executed; the command being executed WILL BE GRANTED FULL ACCESS TO YOUR HOST FILESYSTEM.

args.name: insecureRootCapabilities
args.description: Execute the command with all root capabilities. This is similar to running a command with "sudo" or executing "docker run" with the "--privileged" flag. Containerization does not provide any security guarantees when using this option. It should only be used when absolutely necessary and only with trusted commands.

fields.name: withExposedPort
fields.description:
Expose a network port.

Exposed ports serve two purposes:

- For health checks and introspection, when running services

- For setting the EXPOSE OCI field when publishing the container

args.name: port
args.description: Port number to expose

args.name: protocol
args.description: Transport layer network protocol

args.name: description
args.description: Optional port description

args.name: experimentalSkipHealthcheck
args.description: Skip the health check when run as a service.

fields.name: withFile
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus the contents of the given file copied to the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the copied file (e.g., "/tmp/file.txt").

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the file to copy.

args.name: permissions
args.description: Permission given to the copied file (e.g., 0600).

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the file.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

fields.name: withFiles
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus the contents of the given files copied to the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location where copied files should be placed (e.g., "/src").

args.name: sources
args.description: Identifiers of the files to copy.

args.name: permissions
args.description: Permission given to the copied files (e.g., 0600).

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the files.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

fields.name: withFocus
fields.description: Indicate that subsequent operations should be featured more prominently in the UI.

fields.name: withLabel
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus the given label.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the label (e.g., "org.opencontainers.artifact.created").

args.name: value
args.description: The value of the label (e.g., "2023-01-01T00:00:00Z").

fields.name: withMountedCache
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a cache volume mounted at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the cache directory (e.g., "/cache/node_modules").

args.name: cache
args.description: Identifier of the cache volume to mount.

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the directory to use as the cache volume's root.

args.name: sharing
args.description: Sharing mode of the cache volume.

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the mounted cache directory.

Note that this changes the ownership of the specified mount along with the initial filesystem provided by source (if any). It does not have any effect if/when the cache has already been created.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

fields.name: withMountedDirectory
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a directory mounted at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the mounted directory (e.g., "/mnt/directory").

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the mounted directory.

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the mounted directory and its contents.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

fields.name: withMountedFile
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a file mounted at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the mounted file (e.g., "/tmp/file.txt").

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the mounted file.

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user or user:group to set for the mounted file.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

fields.name: withMountedSecret
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a secret mounted into a file at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the secret file (e.g., "/tmp/secret.txt").

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the secret to mount.

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the mounted secret.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

args.name: mode
args.description:
Permission given to the mounted secret (e.g., 0600).

This option requires an owner to be set to be active.

fields.name: withMountedTemp
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a temporary directory mounted at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the temporary directory (e.g., "/tmp/temp_dir").

fields.name: withNewFile
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a new file written at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the written file (e.g., "/tmp/file.txt").

args.name: contents
args.description: Content of the file to write (e.g., "Hello world!").

args.name: permissions
args.description: Permission given to the written file (e.g., 0600).

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the file.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

fields.name: withRegistryAuth
fields.description: Retrieves this container with a registry authentication for a given address.

args.name: address
args.description:
Registry's address to bind the authentication to.

Formatted as [host]/[user]/[repo]:[tag] (e.g. docker.io/dagger/dagger:main).

args.name: username
args.description: The username of the registry's account (e.g., "Dagger").

args.name: secret
args.description: The API key, password or token to authenticate to this registry.

fields.name: withRootfs
fields.description: Retrieves the container with the given directory mounted to /.

args.name: directory
args.description: Directory to mount.

fields.name: withSecretVariable
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus an env variable containing the given secret.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the secret variable (e.g., "API_SECRET").

args.name: secret
args.description: The identifier of the secret value.

fields.name: withServiceBinding
fields.description:
Establish a runtime dependency on a service.

The service will be started automatically when needed and detached when it is no longer needed, executing the default command if none is set.

The service will be reachable from the container via the provided hostname alias.

The service dependency will also convey to any files or directories produced by the container.

args.name: alias
args.description: A name that can be used to reach the service from the container

args.name: service
args.description: Identifier of the service container

fields.name: withUnixSocket
fields.description: Retrieves this container plus a socket forwarded to the given Unix socket path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the forwarded Unix socket (e.g., "/tmp/socket").

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the socket to forward.

args.name: owner
args.description:
A user:group to set for the mounted socket.

The user and group can either be an ID (1000:1000) or a name (foo:bar).

If the group is omitted, it defaults to the same as the user.

fields.name: withUser
fields.description: Retrieves this container with a different command user.

args.name: name
args.description: The user to set (e.g., "root").

fields.name: withWorkdir
fields.description: Retrieves this container with a different working directory.

args.name: path
args.description: The path to set as the working directory (e.g., "/app").

fields.name: withoutDefaultArgs
fields.description: Retrieves this container with unset default arguments for future commands.

fields.name: withoutEntrypoint
fields.description: Retrieves this container with an unset command entrypoint.

args.name: keepDefaultArgs
args.description: Don't remove the default arguments when unsetting the entrypoint.

fields.name: withoutEnvVariable
fields.description: Retrieves this container minus the given environment variable.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the environment variable (e.g., "HOST").

fields.name: withoutExposedPort
fields.description: Unexpose a previously exposed port.

args.name: port
args.description: Port number to unexpose

args.name: protocol
args.description: Port protocol to unexpose

fields.name: withoutFocus
fields.description:
Indicate that subsequent operations should not be featured more prominently in the UI.

This is the initial state of all containers.

fields.name: withoutLabel
fields.description: Retrieves this container minus the given environment label.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the label to remove (e.g., "org.opencontainers.artifact.created").

fields.name: withoutMount
fields.description: Retrieves this container after unmounting everything at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the cache directory (e.g., "/cache/node_modules").

fields.name: withoutRegistryAuth
fields.description: Retrieves this container without the registry authentication of a given address.

args.name: address
args.description:
Registry's address to remove the authentication from.

Formatted as [host]/[user]/[repo]:[tag] (e.g. docker.io/dagger/dagger:main).

fields.name: withoutUnixSocket
fields.description: Retrieves this container with a previously added Unix socket removed.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the socket to remove (e.g., "/tmp/socket").

fields.name: withoutUser
fields.description:
Retrieves this container with an unset command user.

Should default to root.

fields.name: withoutWorkdir
fields.description:
Retrieves this container with an unset working directory.

Should default to "/".

fields.name: workdir
fields.description: Retrieves the working directory for all commands.

types.name: ContainerID
types.description: The `ContainerID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Container.

types.name: CurrentModule
types.description: Reflective module API provided to functions at runtime.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this CurrentModule.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the module being executed in

fields.name: source
fields.description: The directory containing the module's source code loaded into the engine (plus any generated code that may have been created).

fields.name: workdir
fields.description: Load a directory from the module's scratch working directory, including any changes that may have been made to it during module function execution.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the directory to access (e.g., ".").

args.name: exclude
args.description: Exclude artifacts that match the given pattern (e.g., ["node_modules/", ".git*"]).

args.name: include
args.description: Include only artifacts that match the given pattern (e.g., ["app/", "package.*"]).

fields.name: workdirFile
fields.description: Load a file from the module's scratch working directory, including any changes that may have been made to it during module function execution.Load a file from the module's scratch working directory, including any changes that may have been made to it during module function execution.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the file to retrieve (e.g., "README.md").

types.name: CurrentModuleID
types.description: The `CurrentModuleID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type CurrentModule.

types.name: Directory
types.description: A directory.

fields.name: asModule
fields.description: Load the directory as a Dagger module

args.name: sourceRootPath
args.description:
An optional subpath of the directory which contains the module's configuration file.

This is needed when the module code is in a subdirectory but requires parent directories to be loaded in order to execute. For example, the module source code may need a go.mod, project.toml, package.json, etc. file from a parent directory.

If not set, the module source code is loaded from the root of the directory.

fields.name: diff
fields.description: Gets the difference between this directory and an another directory.

args.name: other
args.description: Identifier of the directory to compare.

fields.name: directory
fields.description: Retrieves a directory at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the directory to retrieve (e.g., "/src").

fields.name: dockerBuild
fields.description: Builds a new Docker container from this directory.

args.name: platform
args.description: The platform to build.

args.name: dockerfile
args.description: Path to the Dockerfile to use (e.g., "frontend.Dockerfile").

args.name: target
args.description: Target build stage to build.

args.name: buildArgs
args.description: Build arguments to use in the build.

args.name: secrets
args.description:
Secrets to pass to the build.

They will be mounted at /run/secrets/[secret-name].

fields.name: entries
fields.description: Returns a list of files and directories at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the directory to look at (e.g., "/src").

fields.name: export
fields.description: Writes the contents of the directory to a path on the host.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the copied directory (e.g., "logs/").

args.name: wipe
args.description: If true, then the host directory will be wiped clean before exporting so that it exactly matches the directory being exported; this means it will delete any files on the host that aren't in the exported dir. If false (the default), the contents of the directory will be merged with any existing contents of the host directory, leaving any existing files on the host that aren't in the exported directory alone.

fields.name: file
fields.description: Retrieves a file at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the file to retrieve (e.g., "README.md").

fields.name: glob
fields.description: Returns a list of files and directories that matche the given pattern.

args.name: pattern
args.description: Pattern to match (e.g., "*.md").

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Directory.

fields.name: pipeline
fields.description: Creates a named sub-pipeline.

args.name: name
args.description: Name of the sub-pipeline.

args.name: description
args.description: Description of the sub-pipeline.

args.name: labels
args.description: Labels to apply to the sub-pipeline.

fields.name: sync
fields.description: Force evaluation in the engine.

fields.name: withDirectory
fields.description: Retrieves this directory plus a directory written at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the written directory (e.g., "/src/").

args.name: directory
args.description: Identifier of the directory to copy.

args.name: exclude
args.description: Exclude artifacts that match the given pattern (e.g., ["node_modules/", ".git*"]).

args.name: include
args.description: Include only artifacts that match the given pattern (e.g., ["app/", "package.*"]).

fields.name: withFile
fields.description: Retrieves this directory plus the contents of the given file copied to the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the copied file (e.g., "/file.txt").

args.name: source
args.description: Identifier of the file to copy.

args.name: permissions
args.description: Permission given to the copied file (e.g., 0600).

fields.name: withFiles
fields.description: Retrieves this directory plus the contents of the given files copied to the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location where copied files should be placed (e.g., "/src").

args.name: sources
args.description: Identifiers of the files to copy.

args.name: permissions
args.description: Permission given to the copied files (e.g., 0600).

fields.name: withNewDirectory
fields.description: Retrieves this directory plus a new directory created at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the directory created (e.g., "/logs").

args.name: permissions
args.description: Permission granted to the created directory (e.g., 0777).

fields.name: withNewFile
fields.description: Retrieves this directory plus a new file written at the given path.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the written file (e.g., "/file.txt").

args.name: contents
args.description: Content of the written file (e.g., "Hello world!").

args.name: permissions
args.description: Permission given to the copied file (e.g., 0600).

fields.name: withTimestamps
fields.description: Retrieves this directory with all file/dir timestamps set to the given time.

args.name: timestamp
args.description:
Timestamp to set dir/files in.

Formatted in seconds following Unix epoch (e.g., 1672531199).

fields.name: withoutDirectory
fields.description: Retrieves this directory with the directory at the given path removed.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the directory to remove (e.g., ".github/").

fields.name: withoutFile
fields.description: Retrieves this directory with the file at the given path removed.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the file to remove (e.g., "/file.txt").

types.name: DirectoryID
types.description: The `DirectoryID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Directory.

types.name: EnvVariable
types.description: An environment variable name and value.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this EnvVariable.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The environment variable name.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The environment variable value.

types.name: EnvVariableID
types.description: The `EnvVariableID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type EnvVariable.

types.name: FieldTypeDef
types.description:
A definition of a field on a custom object defined in a Module.

A field on an object has a static value, as opposed to a function on an object whose value is computed by invoking code (and can accept arguments).

fields.name: description
fields.description: A doc string for the field, if any.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this FieldTypeDef.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the field in lowerCamelCase format.

fields.name: typeDef
fields.description: The type of the field.

types.name: FieldTypeDefID
types.description: The `FieldTypeDefID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type FieldTypeDef.

types.name: File
types.description: A file.

fields.name: contents
fields.description: Retrieves the contents of the file.

fields.name: export
fields.description: Writes the file to a file path on the host.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the written directory (e.g., "output.txt").

args.name: allowParentDirPath
args.description: If allowParentDirPath is true, the path argument can be a directory path, in which case the file will be created in that directory.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this File.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Retrieves the name of the file.

fields.name: size
fields.description: Retrieves the size of the file, in bytes.

fields.name: sync
fields.description: Force evaluation in the engine.

fields.name: withTimestamps
fields.description: Retrieves this file with its created/modified timestamps set to the given time.

args.name: timestamp
args.description:
Timestamp to set dir/files in.

Formatted in seconds following Unix epoch (e.g., 1672531199).

types.name: FileID
types.description: The `FileID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type File.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Function
types.description:
Function represents a resolver provided by a Module.

A function always evaluates against a parent object and is given a set of named arguments.

fields.name: args
fields.description: Arguments accepted by the function, if any.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A doc string for the function, if any.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Function.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the function.

fields.name: returnType
fields.description: The type returned by the function.

fields.name: withArg
fields.description: Returns the function with the provided argument

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the argument

args.name: typeDef
args.description: The type of the argument

args.name: description
args.description: A doc string for the argument, if any

args.name: defaultValue
args.description: A default value to use for this argument if not explicitly set by the caller, if any

fields.name: withDescription
fields.description: Returns the function with the given doc string.

args.name: description
args.description: The doc string to set.

types.name: FunctionArg
types.description:
An argument accepted by a function.

This is a specification for an argument at function definition time, not an argument passed at function call time.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A default value to use for this argument when not explicitly set by the caller, if any.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A doc string for the argument, if any.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this FunctionArg.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the argument in lowerCamelCase format.

fields.name: typeDef
fields.description: The type of the argument.

types.name: FunctionArgID
types.description: The `FunctionArgID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type FunctionArg.

types.name: FunctionCall
types.description: An active function call.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this FunctionCall.

fields.name: inputArgs
fields.description: The argument values the function is being invoked with.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the function being called.

fields.name: parent
fields.description: The value of the parent object of the function being called. If the function is top-level to the module, this is always an empty object.

fields.name: parentName
fields.description: The name of the parent object of the function being called. If the function is top-level to the module, this is the name of the module.

fields.name: returnValue
fields.description: Set the return value of the function call to the provided value.

args.name: value
args.description: JSON serialization of the return value.

types.name: FunctionCallArgValue
types.description: A value passed as a named argument to a function call.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this FunctionCallArgValue.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the argument.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the argument represented as a JSON serialized string.

types.name: FunctionCallArgValueID
types.description: The `FunctionCallArgValueID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type FunctionCallArgValue.

types.name: FunctionCallID
types.description: The `FunctionCallID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type FunctionCall.

types.name: FunctionID
types.description: The `FunctionID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Function.

types.name: GeneratedCode
types.description: The result of running an SDK's codegen.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The directory containing the generated code.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this GeneratedCode.

fields.name: vcsGeneratedPaths
fields.description: List of paths to mark generated in version control (i.e. .gitattributes).

fields.name: vcsIgnoredPaths
fields.description: List of paths to ignore in version control (i.e. .gitignore).

fields.name: withVCSGeneratedPaths
fields.description: Set the list of paths to mark generated in version control.

fields.name: withVCSIgnoredPaths
fields.description: Set the list of paths to ignore in version control.

types.name: GeneratedCodeID
types.description: The `GeneratedCodeID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type GeneratedCode.

types.name: GitModuleSource
types.description: Module source originating from a git repo.

fields.name: cloneURL
fields.description: The URL from which the source's git repo can be cloned.

fields.name: commit
fields.description: The resolved commit of the git repo this source points to.

fields.name: contextDirectory
fields.description: The directory containing everything needed to load load and use the module.

fields.name: htmlURL
fields.description: The URL to the source's git repo in a web browser

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this GitModuleSource.

fields.name: rootSubpath
fields.description: The path to the root of the module source under the context directory. This directory contains its configuration file. It also contains its source code (possibly as a subdirectory).

fields.name: version
fields.description: The specified version of the git repo this source points to.

types.name: GitModuleSourceID
types.description: The `GitModuleSourceID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type GitModuleSource.

types.name: GitRef
types.description: A git ref (tag, branch, or commit).

fields.name: commit
fields.description: The resolved commit id at this ref.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this GitRef.

fields.name: tree
fields.description: The filesystem tree at this ref.

args.name: sshKnownHosts
args.description: DEPRECATED: This option should be passed to `git` instead.

args.name: sshAuthSocket
args.description: DEPRECATED: This option should be passed to `git` instead.

types.name: GitRefID
types.description: The `GitRefID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type GitRef.

types.name: GitRepository
types.description: A git repository.

fields.name: branch
fields.description: Returns details of a branch.

args.name: name
args.description: Branch's name (e.g., "main").

fields.name: commit
fields.description: Returns details of a commit.

args.name: id
args.description: Identifier of the commit (e.g., "b6315d8f2810962c601af73f86831f6866ea798b").

fields.name: head
fields.description: Returns details for HEAD.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this GitRepository.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: Returns details of a ref.

args.name: name
args.description: Ref's name (can be a commit identifier, a tag name, a branch name, or a fully-qualified ref).

fields.name: tag
fields.description: Returns details of a tag.

args.name: name
args.description: Tag's name (e.g., "v0.3.9").

types.name: GitRepositoryID
types.description: The `GitRepositoryID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type GitRepository.

types.name: Host
types.description: Information about the host environment.

fields.name: directory
fields.description: Accesses a directory on the host.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the directory to access (e.g., ".").

args.name: exclude
args.description: Exclude artifacts that match the given pattern (e.g., ["node_modules/", ".git*"]).

args.name: include
args.description: Include only artifacts that match the given pattern (e.g., ["app/", "package.*"]).

fields.name: file
fields.description: Accesses a file on the host.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the file to retrieve (e.g., "README.md").

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Host.

fields.name: service
fields.description: Creates a service that forwards traffic to a specified address via the host.

args.name: host
args.description: Upstream host to forward traffic to.

args.name: ports
args.description:
Ports to expose via the service, forwarding through the host network.

If a port's frontend is unspecified or 0, it defaults to the same as the backend port.

An empty set of ports is not valid; an error will be returned.

fields.name: setSecretFile
fields.description:
Sets a secret given a user-defined name and the file path on the host, and returns the secret.

The file is limited to a size of 512000 bytes.

args.name: name
args.description: The user defined name for this secret.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the file to set as a secret.

fields.name: tunnel
fields.description: Creates a tunnel that forwards traffic from the host to a service.

args.name: service
args.description: Service to send traffic from the tunnel.

args.name: ports
args.description:
Configure explicit port forwarding rules for the tunnel.

If a port's frontend is unspecified or 0, a random port will be chosen by the host.

If no ports are given, all of the service's ports are forwarded. If native is true, each port maps to the same port on the host. If native is false, each port maps to a random port chosen by the host.

If ports are given and native is true, the ports are additive.

args.name: native
args.description:
Map each service port to the same port on the host, as if the service were running natively.

Note: enabling may result in port conflicts.

fields.name: unixSocket
fields.description: Accesses a Unix socket on the host.

args.name: path
args.description: Location of the Unix socket (e.g., "/var/run/docker.sock").

types.name: HostID
types.description: The `HostID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Host.

types.name: ImageLayerCompression
types.description: Compression algorithm to use for image layers.

types.name: ImageMediaTypes
types.description: Mediatypes to use in published or exported image metadata.

types.name: InputTypeDef
types.description:
A graphql input type, which is essentially just a group of named args.
This is currently only used to represent pre-existing usage of graphql input types
in the core API. It is not used by user modules and shouldn't ever be as user
module accept input objects via their id rather than graphql input types.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Static fields defined on this input object, if any.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this InputTypeDef.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the input object.

types.name: InputTypeDefID
types.description: The `InputTypeDefID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type InputTypeDef.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: InterfaceTypeDef
types.description: A definition of a custom interface defined in a Module.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The doc string for the interface, if any.

fields.name: functions
fields.description: Functions defined on this interface, if any.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this InterfaceTypeDef.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the interface.

fields.name: sourceModuleName
fields.description: If this InterfaceTypeDef is associated with a Module, the name of the module. Unset otherwise.

types.name: InterfaceTypeDefID
types.description: The `InterfaceTypeDefID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type InterfaceTypeDef.

types.name: JSON
types.description: An arbitrary JSON-encoded value.

types.name: Label
types.description: A simple key value object that represents a label.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Label.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The label name.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The label value.

types.name: LabelID
types.description: The `LabelID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Label.

types.name: ListTypeDef
types.description: A definition of a list type in a Module.

fields.name: elementTypeDef
fields.description: The type of the elements in the list.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this ListTypeDef.

types.name: ListTypeDefID
types.description: The `ListTypeDefID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type ListTypeDef.

types.name: LocalModuleSource
types.description: Module source that that originates from a path locally relative to an arbitrary directory.

fields.name: contextDirectory
fields.description: The directory containing everything needed to load load and use the module.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this LocalModuleSource.

fields.name: rootSubpath
fields.description: The path to the root of the module source under the context directory. This directory contains its configuration file. It also contains its source code (possibly as a subdirectory).

types.name: LocalModuleSourceID
types.description: The `LocalModuleSourceID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type LocalModuleSource.

types.name: Module
types.description: A Dagger module.

fields.name: dependencies
fields.description: Modules used by this module.

fields.name: dependencyConfig
fields.description: The dependencies as configured by the module.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The doc string of the module, if any

fields.name: generatedContextDiff
fields.description: The generated files and directories made on top of the module source's context directory.

fields.name: generatedContextDirectory
fields.description: The module source's context plus any configuration and source files created by codegen.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Module.

fields.name: initialize
fields.description: Retrieves the module with the objects loaded via its SDK.

fields.name: interfaces
fields.description: Interfaces served by this module.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the module

fields.name: objects
fields.description: Objects served by this module.

fields.name: runtime
fields.description: The container that runs the module's entrypoint. It will fail to execute if the module doesn't compile.

fields.name: sdk
fields.description: The SDK used by this module. Either a name of a builtin SDK or a module source ref string pointing to the SDK's implementation.

fields.name: serve
fields.description:
Serve a module's API in the current session.

Note: this can only be called once per session. In the future, it could return a stream or service to remove the side effect.

fields.name: source
fields.description: The source for the module.

fields.name: withDescription
fields.description: Retrieves the module with the given description

args.name: description
args.description: The description to set

fields.name: withInterface
fields.description: This module plus the given Interface type and associated functions

fields.name: withObject
fields.description: This module plus the given Object type and associated functions.

fields.name: withSource
fields.description: Retrieves the module with basic configuration loaded if present.

args.name: source
args.description: The module source to initialize from.

types.name: ModuleDependency
types.description: The configuration of dependency of a module.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this ModuleDependency.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the dependency module.

fields.name: source
fields.description: The source for the dependency module.

types.name: ModuleDependencyID
types.description: The `ModuleDependencyID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type ModuleDependency.

types.name: ModuleID
types.description: The `ModuleID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Module.

types.name: ModuleSource
types.description: The source needed to load and run a module, along with any metadata about the source such as versions/urls/etc.

fields.name: asGitSource
fields.description: If the source is a of kind git, the git source representation of it.

fields.name: asLocalSource
fields.description: If the source is of kind local, the local source representation of it.

fields.name: asModule
fields.description: Load the source as a module. If this is a local source, the parent directory must have been provided during module source creation

fields.name: asString
fields.description: A human readable ref string representation of this module source.

fields.name: configExists
fields.description: Returns whether the module source has a configuration file.

fields.name: contextDirectory
fields.description: The directory containing everything needed to load load and use the module.

fields.name: dependencies
fields.description: The dependencies of the module source. Includes dependencies from the configuration and any extras from withDependencies calls.

fields.name: directory
fields.description: The directory containing the module configuration and source code (source code may be in a subdir).

args.name: path
args.description: The path from the source directory to select.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this ModuleSource.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The kind of source (e.g. local, git, etc.)

fields.name: moduleName
fields.description: If set, the name of the module this source references, including any overrides at runtime by callers.

fields.name: moduleOriginalName
fields.description: The original name of the module this source references, as defined in the module configuration.

fields.name: resolveContextPathFromCaller
fields.description: The path to the module source's context directory on the caller's filesystem. Only valid for local sources.

fields.name: resolveDependency
fields.description: Resolve the provided module source arg as a dependency relative to this module source.

args.name: dep
args.description: The dependency module source to resolve.

fields.name: resolveDirectoryFromCaller
fields.description: Load a directory from the caller optionally with a given view applied.

args.name: path
args.description: The path on the caller's filesystem to load.

args.name: viewName
args.description: If set, the name of the view to apply to the path.

fields.name: resolveFromCaller
fields.description: Load the source from its path on the caller's filesystem, including only needed+configured files and directories. Only valid for local sources.

fields.name: sourceRootSubpath
fields.description: The path relative to context of the root of the module source, which contains dagger.json. It also contains the module implementation source code, but that may or may not being a subdir of this root.

fields.name: sourceSubpath
fields.description: The path relative to context of the module implementation source code.

fields.name: view
fields.description: Retrieve a named view defined for this module source.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the view to retrieve.

fields.name: views
fields.description: The named views defined for this module source, which are sets of directory filters that can be applied to directory arguments provided to functions.

fields.name: withContextDirectory
fields.description: Update the module source with a new context directory. Only valid for local sources.

args.name: dir
args.description: The directory to set as the context directory.

fields.name: withDependencies
fields.description: Append the provided dependencies to the module source's dependency list.

args.name: dependencies
args.description: The dependencies to append.

fields.name: withName
fields.description: Update the module source with a new name.

args.name: name
args.description: The name to set.

fields.name: withSDK
fields.description: Update the module source with a new SDK.

args.name: sdk
args.description: The SDK to set.

fields.name: withSourceSubpath
fields.description: Update the module source with a new source subpath.

args.name: path
args.description: The path to set as the source subpath.

fields.name: withView
fields.description: Update the module source with a new named view.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the view to set.

args.name: patterns
args.description: The patterns to set as the view filters.

types.name: ModuleSourceID
types.description: The `ModuleSourceID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type ModuleSource.

types.name: ModuleSourceKind
types.description: The kind of module source.

types.name: ModuleSourceView
types.description: A named set of path filters that can be applied to directory arguments provided to functions.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this ModuleSourceView.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the view

fields.name: patterns
fields.description: The patterns of the view used to filter paths

types.name: ModuleSourceViewID
types.description: The `ModuleSourceViewID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type ModuleSourceView.

types.name: NetworkProtocol
types.description: Transport layer network protocol associated to a port.

types.name: ObjectTypeDef
types.description: A definition of a custom object defined in a Module.

fields.name: constructor
fields.description: The function used to construct new instances of this object, if any

fields.name: description
fields.description: The doc string for the object, if any.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Static fields defined on this object, if any.

fields.name: functions
fields.description: Functions defined on this object, if any.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this ObjectTypeDef.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the object.

fields.name: sourceModuleName
fields.description: If this ObjectTypeDef is associated with a Module, the name of the module. Unset otherwise.

types.name: ObjectTypeDefID
types.description: The `ObjectTypeDefID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type ObjectTypeDef.

types.name: PipelineLabel
types.description: Key value object that represents a pipeline label.

types.name: Platform
types.description:
The platform config OS and architecture in a Container.

The format is [os]/[platform]/[version] (e.g., "darwin/arm64/v7", "windows/amd64", "linux/arm64").

types.name: Port
types.description: A port exposed by a container.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The port description.

fields.name: experimentalSkipHealthcheck
fields.description: Skip the health check when run as a service.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Port.

fields.name: port
fields.description: The port number.

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: The transport layer protocol.

types.name: PortForward
types.description: Port forwarding rules for tunneling network traffic.

inputFields.name: frontend
inputFields.description: Port to expose to clients. If unspecified, a default will be chosen.

inputFields.name: protocol
inputFields.description: Transport layer protocol to use for traffic.

types.name: PortID
types.description: The `PortID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Port.

types.name: Secret
types.description: A reference to a secret value, which can be handled more safely than the value itself.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Secret.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this secret.

fields.name: plaintext
fields.description: The value of this secret.

types.name: SecretID
types.description: The `SecretID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Secret.

types.name: Service
types.description: A content-addressed service providing TCP connectivity.

fields.name: endpoint
fields.description:
Retrieves an endpoint that clients can use to reach this container.

If no port is specified, the first exposed port is used. If none exist an error is returned.

If a scheme is specified, a URL is returned. Otherwise, a host:port pair is returned.

args.name: port
args.description: The exposed port number for the endpoint

args.name: scheme
args.description: Return a URL with the given scheme, eg. http for http://

fields.name: hostname
fields.description: Retrieves a hostname which can be used by clients to reach this container.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Service.

fields.name: ports
fields.description: Retrieves the list of ports provided by the service.

fields.name: start
fields.description:
Start the service and wait for its health checks to succeed.

Services bound to a Container do not need to be manually started.

fields.name: stop
fields.description: Stop the service.

args.name: kill
args.description: Immediately kill the service without waiting for a graceful exit

fields.name: up
fields.description: Creates a tunnel that forwards traffic from the caller's network to this service.

args.name: ports
args.description:
List of frontend/backend port mappings to forward.

Frontend is the port accepting traffic on the host, backend is the service port.

args.name: random
args.description: Bind each tunnel port to a random port on the host.

types.name: ServiceID
types.description: The `ServiceID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Service.

types.name: Socket
types.description: A Unix or TCP/IP socket that can be mounted into a container.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Socket.

types.name: SocketID
types.description: The `SocketID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Socket.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Terminal
types.description: An interactive terminal that clients can connect to.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this Terminal.

fields.name: websocketEndpoint
fields.description: An http endpoint at which this terminal can be connected to over a websocket.

types.name: TerminalID
types.description: The `TerminalID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type Terminal.

types.name: TypeDef
types.description: A definition of a parameter or return type in a Module.

fields.name: asInput
fields.description: If kind is INPUT, the input-specific type definition. If kind is not INPUT, this will be null.

fields.name: asInterface
fields.description: If kind is INTERFACE, the interface-specific type definition. If kind is not INTERFACE, this will be null.

fields.name: asList
fields.description: If kind is LIST, the list-specific type definition. If kind is not LIST, this will be null.

fields.name: asObject
fields.description: If kind is OBJECT, the object-specific type definition. If kind is not OBJECT, this will be null.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this TypeDef.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The kind of type this is (e.g. primitive, list, object).

fields.name: optional
fields.description: Whether this type can be set to null. Defaults to false.

fields.name: withConstructor
fields.description: Adds a function for constructing a new instance of an Object TypeDef, failing if the type is not an object.

fields.name: withField
fields.description: Adds a static field for an Object TypeDef, failing if the type is not an object.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the field in the object

args.name: typeDef
args.description: The type of the field

args.name: description
args.description: A doc string for the field, if any

fields.name: withFunction
fields.description: Adds a function for an Object or Interface TypeDef, failing if the type is not one of those kinds.

fields.name: withInterface
fields.description: Returns a TypeDef of kind Interface with the provided name.

fields.name: withKind
fields.description: Sets the kind of the type.

fields.name: withListOf
fields.description: Returns a TypeDef of kind List with the provided type for its elements.

fields.name: withObject
fields.description:
Returns a TypeDef of kind Object with the provided name.

Note that an object's fields and functions may be omitted if the intent is only to refer to an object. This is how functions are able to return their own object, or any other circular reference.

fields.name: withOptional
fields.description: Sets whether this type can be set to null.

types.name: TypeDefID
types.description: The `TypeDefID` scalar type represents an identifier for an object of type TypeDef.

types.name: TypeDefKind
types.description: Distinguishes the different kinds of TypeDefs.

enumValues.name: LIST_KIND
enumValues.description:
A list of values all having the same type.

Always paired with a ListTypeDef.

enumValues.name: OBJECT_KIND
enumValues.description:
A named type defined in the GraphQL schema, with fields and functions.

Always paired with an ObjectTypeDef.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE_KIND
enumValues.description:
A named type of functions that can be matched+implemented by other objects+interfaces.

Always paired with an InterfaceTypeDef.

enumValues.name: INPUT_KIND
enumValues.description: A graphql input type, used only when representing the core API via TypeDefs.

enumValues.name: VOID_KIND
enumValues.description:
A special kind used to signify that no value is returned.

This is used for functions that have no return value. The outer TypeDef specifying this Kind is always Optional, as the Void is never actually represented.

types.name: Void
types.description:
The absence of a value.

A Null Void is used as a placeholder for resolvers that do not return anything.
